interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Cats (1999)
Review Date: 2014/10/20
Store: Elaine Paige  (Actor),     John Mills  (Actor),     David Mallet  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Musicals & Performing Arts, Musicals
Product Description: ['Product Description', '"Cats" opened at The Winter Garden on October 7, 1982, carrying an advance of $6.2 million, the largest in Broadway history. In 1997 it surpassed "A Chorus Line" as the longest running show in Broadway history. On September 10, 2000, after 7,485 shows and a run of nearly 18 years, the show closed - a Broadway record. For the first time ever, an Andrew Lloyd Webber show has been specially filmed and made available on video. With a star cast including Elaine Paige and Sir John Mills, and its stunning production values, Cats will no doubt set a new standard for the filming of all future musicals. Andrew Lloyd Webber\'s Cats, the most famous musical of all time, first exploded onto the West End stage in 1981. \'Memory\', one of its many classic songs, became an instant worldwide hit. Since then Cats has smashed records and conquered the world. Using the latest technology, all the excitement, thrill, romance and intimacy of this theatrical legend has been captured on screen. Breathtaking visuals and full digital sound (that has been completely re-recorded with a seventy piece orchestra) will lead you deep into the mysterious world of Cats. Cats - as you\'ll never see it again - more intoxicating and magical than you could possibly imagine.', 'Set Contains:', 'The 30-minute documentary "What\'s a Jellicle Cat? The Making of', 'Cats', 'the Video" provides a backstage look at the video version of the longest-running show in Broadway history. After a brief discussion of the original show\'s start in 1981, the bulk of the time is spent on the creation of the video and the advantages it had over a stage production--a larger orchestra, clearer lyrics, and close-ups for better story-telling. There\'s plenty of rehearsal footage, plus comments by Lloyd Webber, director-choreographer Gillian Lynne, Elaine Paige (Grizabella), and other cast members. Of course "Memory" is discussed, and an excerpt of it played by the orchestra without vocals is positively gorgeous.', '--David Horiuchi']
Average Rating: 4.7

Review Text: I love the costumes and the songs.
Review Title: Here Kitty

I loved this series.  I wish there were more.  The storylines are very interesting and watching it, it makes you feel like you were actually there living in the tim.  Derek Jacobi makes an excellent Cadfael.  After reading the whole series it was grand to see it put to life.  I would recommend this to anyone who has an interest in this time frame of life.
Puts you into the picture

Jason Alexander  (Actor),     Jodi Benson  (Actor),     Jim Kammerud  (Director),     Brian Smith  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Anime
['UPC:786936757125DESCRIPTION:Disney s irresistible classic continues in this delightful Special Edition, 101 Dalmatians II: Patch s London Adventure releasing for a limited time only on Disney DVD! All of the loveable Dalmatians return, including Patch who longs to be special not just one of the one hundred and one. When the villain Cruella De Vil kidnaps his brothers and sisters, Patch enlists the help of his TV-idol, Thunderbolt, to rescue the pups from Cruella s clutches. Non-stop thrills and inspiring messages of discovery make this animated adventure unforgettable fun for the entire family. END']

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Interest in Historical Narratives**: The user has a strong preference for content that immerses them in historical settings, appreciating storylines that evoke a sense of being part of the time period.

- **Character Appreciation**: They show a clear affinity for well-developed characters, indicating that performances by skilled actors enhance their viewing experience.

- **Quality Over Quantity**: The user values well-crafted series and seeks depth and richness in storytelling, often desiring more content when they enjoy a series.

- **Moderate Content Sensitivity**: They exhibit discernment regarding themes they engage with, being mindful of content advisories related to violence and strong language.

- **Family-Oriented Content**: The user leans towards animated, family-friendly films that engage younger audiences and values content that resonates with family members, emphasizing the communal aspect of their viewing habits.

- **Recommendation Inclination**: Likely to recommend content they enjoy to others, reflecting their engaged approach to entertainment choices.

- **Theater and Musical Enthusiasm**: Recently showcased an interest in celebrated theatrical performances, particularly musicals, noting elements such as costumes and music as key enjoyment factors. This suggests an appreciation for the artistry and production of live performances captured on screen.

Overall, the user appreciates high-quality, character-driven stories that provide immersive experiences across various genres, highlighting their thoughtful, engaged approach to diverse entertainment options.
